## ğŸ’» Create React App ğŸ‘‡

```bash
npx create-react-app .
```

<hr>

## âŒ You can delete these files under "src" folder ğŸ‘‡

- setupTests.js
- reportWebVitals.js
- logo.svg
- index.css
- App.css
- App.test.js

## âœ Configure "index.js" file after deleting files ğŸ‘‡

```javascript
import React from 'react';
import ReactDOM from 'react-dom/client';
import './style.css';
import App from './App';

const root = ReactDOM.createRoot(document.getElementById('root'));
root.render(
  <React.StrictMode>
    <App />
  </React.StrictMode>
);
```

## âœ Configure "App.js" file after deleting files ğŸ‘‡

```javascript
function App() {
  return (
    <div className="App">
      Test
    </div>
  );
}

export default App;
```

<hr>

## ğŸ’» Install Tailwind CSS ğŸ‘‡

```bash
npm install -D tailwindcss
npx tailwindcss init
```

## âœ To configure your template paths; add the paths to all of your template files in your "tailwind.config.js" file ğŸ‘‡

```javascript
/** @type {import('tailwindcss').Config} */
module.exports = {
  mode: 'jit',
  content: [
    "./src/**/*.{js,jsx,ts,tsx}",
    './src/**/*.{html,js}',
  ],
  theme: {
    extend: {},
  },
  plugins: [],
}
```

## âœ” To add the Tailwind directives to your CSS; create "tailwind.css" file under "src" folder, add this script to "package.json" file and run this command at the terminal ğŸ‘‡

```json
    "watch": "npx tailwindcss -i src/tailwind.css -o src/style.css --watch"
```

## ğŸš© Add the @tailwind directives for each of Tailwindâ€™s layers to your main CSS file ğŸ‘‡

```css
@tailwind base;
@tailwind components;
@tailwind utilities;
```

<hr>

## â€¼ Create "jsconfig.json" file in home directory to set "src" folder as Absolute Path and add ğŸ‘‡

```json
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "baseUrl": "src"
  },
  "include": [
    "src"
  ],
  "exclude": [
    "node_modules",
    "build"
  ]
}
```

<hr>

## âœ” Create a "components" folder under "src" folder. And add "Header.jsx", "HeroSection.jsx", "Categories.jsx", "Campaigns.jsx", "Favorites.jsx", "MobileApp.jsx", "Cards.jsx", "Footer.jsx" components and import them in "App.js" ğŸ‘‡

```javascript
import Header from "components/Header"
import HeroSection from "components/HeroSection"
import Categories from "components/Categories"
import Campaigns from "components/Campaigns"
import Favorites from "components/Favorites"
import MobileApp from "components/MobileApp"
import Cards from "components/Cards"
import Footer from "components/Footer"

function App() {
  return (
    <>
      <Header />
      <HeroSection/>
      <Categories/>
      <Campaigns/>
      <Favorites/>
      <MobileApp/>
      <Cards/>
      <Footer/>
    </>
  );
}

export default App;
```

<hr>

## âœ By default, Tailwind makes the entire default color palette available as background colors. You can customize your color palette by editing theme.colors or theme.extend.colors in your "tailwind.config.js" file ğŸ‘‡

```javascript
theme: {
    extend: {
      colors: {
        'brand-color': '#4c3398',
        'primary-brand-color': '#5d3ebc',
        'secondary-brand-color': '#7849f7',
        'brand-yellow': '#ffd300',
      },
    },
  },
```

<hr>

## âœ  For controlling the font smoothing of an element; customize "tailwind.css" file ğŸ‘‡

```css
@layer base {
    html, body {
        @apply antialiased
    }
}
```

## âœ  Import "Open Sans" font (Regular 400, SemiBold 600, Bold 700) from GoogleFonts and add it to "layer base" ğŸ‘‡

```css
@import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Open+Sans:wght@400;600;700&display=swap');

@layer base {
    html, body {
        font-family: "Open Sans", sans-serif;
        @apply antialiased
    }
}
```

<hr>

## ğŸ’» Install React Icons ğŸ‘‡

```bash
npm install react-icons --save
```

## ğŸš© For "Header.jsx" copy the src of "getir" images from "https://getir.com/" and finish the component ğŸ‘‡

```javascript
import React from 'react'
import { FiGlobe } from "react-icons/fi"
import { FaUserAlt, FaUserPlus } from "react-icons/fa"

export const Header = () => {
  return (
    <div className='bg-brand-color '>
      <div className='container mx-auto h-11 flex items-center justify-between'>
        <a href="/">
          <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," alt="" />
        </a>
        <nav className='flex gap-x-8 text-sm font-semibold'>
          <a href="/" className='flex items-center gap-x-2 text-white transition-all hover:text-opacity-100 text-opacity-80'><FiGlobe size={20} />TÃ¼rkÃ§e (TR)</a>
          <a href="/" className='flex items-center gap-x-2 text-white transition-all hover:text-opacity-100 text-opacity-80'><FaUserAlt size={20} />GiriÅŸ Yap</a>
          <a href="/" className='flex items-center gap-x-2 text-white transition-all hover:text-opacity-100 text-opacity-80'><FaUserPlus size={20} />KayÄ±t Ol</a>
        </nav>
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}
export default Header;
```

<hr>

## ğŸ’» For "HeroSection" component; install "React Slick" (React slick is a carousel component built with React. It is a react port of  slick carousel.(https://react-slick.neostack.com/docs/get-started)) ğŸ‘‡

```bash
npm install react-slick --save
```

## âœ Add these urls to "tailwind.css" ğŸ‘‡

```css
@import url('https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/slick-carousel/1.6.0/slick.min.css');
@import url('"https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/slick-carousel/1.6.0/slick-theme.min.css');
```

## ğŸ’» Install "react-flags-select" (A React library that provides a customizable SVG flags select components and standalone SVG flags components.) for for selection country code of the phone. [view...](https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-flags-select)ğŸ‘‡

```bash
yarn add react-flags-select
npm install react-flags-select --save
```
